results.title: Surcouf
results.creator_credit: Georges de la Giraudiere and Roy Rowland
results.brief_description:
The first of two films (in our collection) recounting the exploits of famous privateer Robert Surcouf and starring Gerard Barray. On 6 October 1801, in the Sea of Bengal, Surcouf and his crew attack the English vessel ‘Kent’. See also: Le Retour de Surcouf (X000345, 16mm).

Credits: Producer, Georges de la Giraudiere ; director, Roy Rowland ; photography, Juan Gelpi.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Antonella Lualdi, Genevieve Casile, Terrence Morgan.

results.title: Sur mer et sur terre etc.
results.brief_description: Five French language programmes taken in location in and arround Fecamp and Potiers: 1. “Sur mer et sur terre”. 2. “Par les rues”. 3. “Chemin faisant”. 4. “Ecole, travail, familie”. 5. Loisirs”.

results.title: Sur les Bords du Saint-Laurent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Today is the day for Jacinthe and Bicou to present for their dance exam. Jacinthe gives her precious ring to Bicou’s father for tightening. He is quick to realise that the ring is not a prop but a high quality diamond.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and Jean-Paul Ladouceur
results.brief_description: Extravagantly gowned marionettes perform the pantomimes in this old French folksong, with vocal interpretations by the Trio Lyrique.

results.title: Supreme self-confidence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Paul McKenna’s easy way to health & fitness”.
Hypnotist Paul McKenna presents a program designed to improve self-confidence by making hypnotic and subliminal suggestions aimed at the unconscious.

results.title: Supporting behavior (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera, Phil Content and Science Research Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”
We all need others to add their strength to our own. In the classroom pupils need support and guidance from teachers to give them the power to cope. A good teacher manages the classroom so that everyone gets a chance to express himself and grow.

results.title: Supply and drainage ditches
results.creator_credit: CSIRO. Film Unit and J.J. Walker
results.brief_description: Stresses the need for control of irrigation water by the design and construction of ditches capable of handling an adequate flow of water. Describes the design, lay-out and construction of an efficient irrigation system without which fertile land may be ruined by water logging and salting.
results.description: Stresses the need for control of irrigation water by the design and construction of ditches capable of handling an adequate flow of water. results.title: Supply and demand
results.creator_credit: Bruce Stubblefield, Greenhouse Films and Ted Abenheim
results.brief_description: Basic introductory film on the concepts of supply and demand. Defines the law of supply and the law of demand, shows how the equilibrium point between these two laws determines prices, and provides examples of these laws in real life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Stubblefield, Greenhouse Films and Ted Abenheim

results.title: Supervisory conferences
results.creator_credit: Edward L. Gershman, Art Babbitt, McGraw-Hill Text-Films and Academy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”
Dramatised incidents in an industrial plant are used to show how conferences on the supervisory level lead to effective handling, training and utilisation of employees.
